snippet: What is notable about the start of the new fall TV season, according to network executives, is a surge in not just delayed viewing, but very-delayed viewing.
abstract: On-demand television viewing behaviors, which have been reshaping TV since first DVR in 1999, are becoming more pronounced with each passing year, sometimes to ratings benefit of networks and advertisers and other times to their detriment; viewers who might have previously time-shifted a particular show are now waiting longer to watch, partly due to sheer number of shows on their mental to-watch lists.
lead_paragraph: What is notable about the start of the new fall TV season, according to network executives, is a surge in not just delayed viewing, but very-delayed viewing.

headline.main: As DVRs Shift TV Habits, Ratings Calculations Follow
headline.print_headline: DVRs Shift TV Habits, And Ratings
